title: Elastic collisions in kinetic theory of gases

content.question: In the kinetic theory of gases, it is assumed that collisions between particles in an ideal gas are perfectly elastic. Which of the following claims is true based on this assumption?

choices.label: The average kinetic energy of the gas particles does not change due to interactions between particles.
The temperature of the gas does not depend on the motion of the gas particles.
No energy is transferred between gas particles when they collide.
All the gas particles have the same speed.

content.answer: The average kinetic energy of the gas particles does not change due to interactions between particles.

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
